Please Choose Quiz Mode
Answer the questions and add your insight about human mind and brain, become smarter is always be cool :)
Right Or Wrong Quiz
Multiple Choice
Let\'s Begin a Short Brief About This Quiz
Is It Right or Wrong?

In this mode 50 questions will be available with only two choices of answers, true or false. Any questions answered correctly will get +2 score, but be aware, any wrong answer will reduce your score -1. Your job is to conquer as many of these as possible and get the highest score. Wohoooo! By the way do not forget to read the unique facts that appear every time you answer the question, meaning that every question you answer really adds to your real knowledge points. :)
Let\'s Go!
How to Beat This Challenge?
Question
right
wrong
Your Answer is Correct!
Your Answer is Not Correct!
Sound\'s Interesting!
Brain uses about 5% of total energy and oxygen.
In facts, The typical brain is about 2% of a body’s weight but uses 20% of its total energy and oxygen intake
Brain is 53% water.
In facts, Your brain is 73% water. It takes only 2% dehydration to affect your attention, memory and other cognitive skills
Brain is the fattiest organ
In facts, Your brain weighs about 3 pounds. Of that, the dry weight is 60% fat, making your brain the fattiest organ
Our Brain needs cholesterol

In facts, Twenty-five percent of the body’s cholesterol resides within the brain. Cholesterol is an integral part of every brain cell. Without adequate cholesterol, brain cells die. Obviously you must control your cholesterol.
Brain contain 1 million brain cells
In facts, our brain contain far more. No one knows for sure, but the latest estimate is that our brains contain roughly 86 billion brain cells
All brain cells are same
In facts, All brain cells are not alike. There are as many as 10,000 specific types of neurons in the brain
Adult brain grows faster than babies brain.
In facts, Babies have big heads to hold rapidly growing brains. A 2-year-old’s brain is 80% of adult size
Our brain move between cells faster than Formula 1 race
In facts, Brain information moves anywhere between 1 mph and an impressive 268 miles per hour. This is faster than Formula 1 race cars which top out at 240 mph
Our brain contain electricity
In facts, Your brain generates about 12-25 watts of electricity. This is enough to power a low wattage LED light
About 100,000 chemicals reactions take place in brain every second
In facts, More than 100,000 chemicals reactions take place in your brain every second
Female brain are bigger than men’s brain
In facts, generally men’s brains are 10% bigger than women’s, even after taking into account larger body size
Albert Einstein brain are bigger than average people brain
In facts, Albert Einstein’s brain weighed 2.71 pounds (1,230 grams) — 10% smaller than the average of 3 pounds (1,400 grams). However, the neuron density of his brain was greater than average
Human have the biggest brain among all creatures
In facts, Humans don’t have the biggest brains. That honor belongs to sperm whales with 17-pound brains
Multitask makes our brain work more productive

In facts, Multitasking makes you less productive. When you multitask, your brain simply rapidly toggles back and forth between tasks. This results in decreases in attention span, learning, performance, and short-term memory
Millennials people (aged 18 to 34) are less forgetful
In facts, Surprisingly, millennials (aged 18 to 34) are more forgetful than baby boomers. They are more likely to forget what day it is or where they put their keys than their parents
Brain cells cannibalize themselves
In facts, Brain cells cannibalize themselves as a last ditch source of energy to ward off starvation. So in very real ways dieting can force your brain to eat itself
Our brain can store unlimited information
In facts, Your brain’s storage capacity is considered virtually unlimited. It doesn’t get “used up” like RAM in your computer
We are only using 10% of our brains
The popular myth that we use only 10% of our brains is flat-out wrong. Brain scans clearly show that we use most of our brain most of the time, even when we’re sleeping
Left-brainded personality type are analytics person, and Right-brainded personality type are creative person
In facts, There is no such thing as a left-brain or right-brain personality type. We are not left-brained or right-brained; we are “whole brained.”
Our brain cells are far more than stars in the Milky Way

You may have heard that we have more brain cells than there are stars in the Milky Way, but this is not true. In facts, Best guess estimates are that we have 86 billion neurons and there are 200-400 billion stars in the Milky Way
Emotions can affects how accurately we remember something
In facts, Memories are shockingly unreliable. Emotions, motivation, cues, context and frequency of use can all affect how accurately you remember something
One Information to memorize are stored in one place in our brains

In facts, Memory is more of an activity than a place. Any given memory is deconstructed and distributed in different parts of the brain. Then, for the memory to be recalled, it gets reconstructed from the individual fragments
When we drunk, our brain is capable of forming memories
If you were drinking and don’t remember what you did last night, it’s not because you forgot. While you are drunk your brain is incapable of forming memories
Our brain are a solid organ
The human brain is not solid. It’s soft and squishy similar to the consistency of soft tofu or soft gelatin. And it’s very fragile
Life with half of our brain is impossible

Sometimes half a brain is a good as a whole one. When surgeons perform a hemispherectomy, they remove or disable half of the brain to stop seizures. Shockingly, patients experience no effect on personality or memory
Most of our decision are take place in our subconscious mind
Think you’re in control of your life? Think again. 95% of your decisions take place in your subconscious mind
Neurons in our body is only in our brain

The brain in your head isn’t your only brain. There’s a “second brain” in your intestines that contains 100 million neurons. Gut bacteria are responsible for making over 30 neurotransmitters including the “happy molecule” serotonin
Sleeping pills put our brain into state similar to being coma
Prescription sleeping pills don’t put you to sleep. They put your brain into a state similar to being in a coma, essentially bypassing any restorative value of sleep
Our cell phone can damage our brain
Over 140 proteins in the brain are negatively impacted by exposure to electromagnetic frequencies — the kind emitted by your cell phone and other electronic devices
When we feel pain, our brain is also feel the pain
Although pain is processed in your brain, your brain has no pain receptors and feels no pain. This explains how brain surgery can be performed while the patient is awake with no pain or discomfort
Children who learn to play a musical instrument are smarter

Most scientists argue that there is no evidence that playing classical music to babies increases the power of their mind. However, children who learn to play a musical instrument can develop their mental skills further than those who don’t learn a musical instrument
Feelings are part of our conscious mind

The conscious mind includes sensations, perceptions, memories, feelings, and fantasies inside of our current awareness. The preconscious mind includes those thoughts that we are thinking at the moment but can easily draw into our conscious mind. The subconscious mind is the psychic activity that operates below the level of awareness
Remember everything and never forget every single one is a good thing

Solomon Shereshevsky was a Russian journalist who couldn’t forget. He suffered from synesthesia, a phenomenon in which one sense (for example, vision) stimulates another sense (such as hearing). Solomon’s extreme synesthesia led him to taste, smell, and see vivid images in conjunction with numbers and sounds. Because a single word could trigger a flood of memories and associations, he had a difficult time reading a book or having a simple conversation
Recalls a memory in our brain is an act of creative reimagination and reconstruction

When the mind recalls a memory, it’s not the original memory. In fact, the act of remembering is an act of creative reimagination. The put-together memory doesn’t just have a few holes; it also has some entirely new bits pasted in
Repeated false question can create real false memory in out mind

Research has proven how easy it is to create false memories through the force of suggestion. Psychologists found that if they repeated questions and invited the mind to imagine sensory detail, a person would begin to believe it was an actual event.
Advertisers use mind illusions to make their products more appealing

For example, they produce condiment bottles with long necks because the mind is better at judging size than volume. Bottles of maple syrup are narrow at the base but bulge in the middle because that is where a person is most likely to look.
Internet are changing the structure of our brains, and change the mind ability to think and to learn
Specifically, the Internet overstimulates the part of the brain involved in temporary memory so that deep thinking and creativity become increasingly difficult.
Scent are bad memory triggers
Memories that are triggered by scent have some of the strongest emotional connections and appear more intense than other memory triggers
Depressed people dream often
Depressed people dream three times as much as people who are not sad
Looking to photo of loved one can be an analgesic
\"looking at a photo of your loved one can reduce physical pain up to 44%. The effect is almost identical to that of a common analgesic. \"
Video games can produce an heroin in our brain

Video games can produce an addiction as strong as heroin. Surely this has to do with the mechanisms that activate willpower, because the strength of willpower depends in great measure on the amount of oxygen and glucose within your brain
Human brain can distinguish fantasy and real experiences

Despite its great capacity, the human brain doesn’t have a good ability to distinguish between fantasy and real experiences. Thus, someone can experience a movie as if it were an event that happened in the real world. You can feel sadness, fear or enthusiasm the same way you would if you were truly experiencing that event
Our brain can’t feel what another person feel

Someone can physically feel a hit that another person receives, if this greatly impacts them emotionally. This is because there are cells in the brain called “mirror neurons” that reproduce the experience as if you were the one living it
Subconscious mind are more powerful than conscious mind
According to Dr. Bruce Lipton, the subconscious is 1-million times more powerful than the conscious mind. Tapping into the power of the subconscious mind should never ever be underestimated.
10 quadrillion operation per second is to much operation for our brain

The human brain is the universe\'s most powerful quantum processing supercomputer. The brain is capable of performing all sorts of complex simultaneous processes, even when (or especially when) we are asleep
Human mind can’t be programmed, it only flows itself
Hypnosis, NLP (Neuro Linguistic Programming) and other similar models are perfect examples of how this can be done effectively
It needs more than 30 minutes without oxygen to damage our brain
In facts, Only 5 minutes without oxygen can cause brain damage
We only produce about 100 thoughts per day through our brain.
In facts, The average brain is believed to generate around 50,000 thoughts per day. Disturbingly, it’s estimated that in most people 70% of these thoughts are negative
Our brain is larger than human 10,000 years ago
In facts, Our brains are getting smaller. Over the past 10-20,000 years, the size of the average human brain has shrunk by the size of a tennis ball
There are 10,000 miles of blood vessels in brain
It’s often said there are 10,000 miles of blood vessels in the brain when, in fact, that number is closer to 400 miles. Still a substantial amount
Select One Best Answer

In this mode, 10 questions will be available in multiple choice formats. Choose one of the five answers provided. Don\'t worry, this mode is very relaxed, because there is absolutely no score, and if you have not answered the question correctly, you can not continue to the next question. It\'s easy, right? Personality Test
Know yourself deeper in personality, and open your maximum potential. This personality test is compiled with a standard that has been widely used, so you do not have to hesitate :)
Please Choose Quiz Standard
MBTI Personality Test

In this mode, you will be presented with 60 questions, where each question will be listed a statement. Your job is to choose the statement that best suits your personality, of course the more you are honest in this test, the more accurate the results. After the question is complete, then your personal results will be instantly displayed on the screen, Hurray! :)

Test your basic intellectual abilities with standards that have been developed by experts.
Cognitive vs Intuitive Thinking

Cognitive Reflection Test is a FASTEST IQ test in the world! CRT consists of only 3 questions, and is able to measure our tendency in thinking, cognitive or intuitive. This test was developed by Dr. Frederick. Too easy? do not be cocky first, prove you can answer this simple question! :)
Answer These Question Carefully!
Your Answer:
Are You Sure With Your Answer?
A bat and a ball cost $1.10 in total. The bat costs $1.00 more than the ball. How much does the ball cost? _____ cents
If it takes 5 machines 5 minutes to make 5 widgets, how long would it take 100 machines to make 100 widgets? _____ minutes

In a lake, there is a patch of lily pads. Every day, the patch doubles in size. If it takes 48 days for the patch to cover the entire lake, how long would it take for the patch to cover half of the lake? _____ days
Field Cannot be Empty

Serious, calm, stable, and peaceful. Pleased on facts, logical, objective, practical, and realistic. Task oriented, diligent, organized, keeping promises, reliable, and responsible. A good listener, faithful, just sharing with people close. Stick to rules, standards, and procedures.

Learn to understand the feelings and needs of others. Reduce the desire to control others or order them to enforce the rules. Look at more positive sides to others or other things. Be open to changes.
Field Management, Police, Intelligence, Judge, Lawyer, Doctor, Accountant (Finance Staff), Programmer or IT-related, System Analys, Military Leader
ESFP or ESTP
"Responsible"

Full consideration, careful, thorough and accurate. Serious, calm, stable but sensitive. Friendly, attentive to the feelings and needs of others, loyal, cooperative, good listener. Have the ability to organize, detail, thorough, very responsible and reliable.

See deeper, more enthusiastic, and more spirit. Learn to say AtidakA. Do not please everyone or you are considered a plin plan. Do not get caught in the comfort zone and routine. Try new things. There are many fun things you may not have tried.
Architect, Interior Designer, Nurse, Administrative, Designer, Child Care, Counselor, Back Office Manager, Shopkeeper / Library, World of Hospitality.
ESFP or ESTP
"faithful"

Quiet, quiet, tend to be stiff, cool, cautious, full of consideration. Logical, rational, critical, objective, able to put aside feelings. Able to deal with sudden changes quickly and calmly. Confident, firm and able to face differences and criticism. Be able to analyze, organize, and delegate. Problem solver is good especially for technical problems and sudden state.

Observe social life, what makes people angry, love, happy, motivated and apply to your relationship. Learn to recognize your feelings and express them. Be a more open person, get out of the comfort zone, explore new ideas, and discuss with others. Do not look around for people\'s mistakes just to solve the problem. Do not store information that should be shared and learn to entrust responsibility to others.
Police, Forensic Expert, Programmer, Computer Expert, System Analyst, Technician, Engineer, Mechanical, Pilot, Athlete, Entrepreneur
ESTJ or ENTJ
"Pragmatic"

Simple and practical thinking, flexible, sensitive, friendly, self-effacing, humble to his abilities. Avoiding conflict, not forcing opinions or values ​​on others. Usually do not want to lead but become faithful followers and implementers. Often relaxed getting things done, because they really enjoy what\'s happening right now. Shows more attention through actions than words.

Do not be afraid of rejection and conflict. You do not have to please everyone. Try to start thinking about the long-term impact of small decisions today. Sharpen and develop the side of creativity and art within you as a good capital in you. Try to be more open and express your feelings.
Artists, Designers, Social Workers, Counselors, Psychologists, Teachers, Actors, Hospitality Sector
ESFJ or ENFJ
"Artistic"

Attention, empathy, sensitive and committed to a relationship. Success because of diligence, originality and a strong desire to do whatever is necessary including giving the best in the job. Idealist, perfectionist, adhering to the principle. Visionary, full of ideas, creative, thoughtful and inspiring. Usually followed and respected for clarity of vision and dedication to good things.

Balance your point of view. Do not just look at the negative side and risk. However, look at the positive side and opportunities. Be patient, do not get angry and blame others or situations. Relax and do not constantly think or complete responsibilities.
Educator, Psychologist, Doctor, Counselor, Social Worker, Photographer, Artist, Designer, Child Care.
ESFP or ESTP
"Reflective"

Visionary, has practical planning, and usually has original ideas and a strong drive to achieve them. Independent and confident. Have good analytical skills and simplify something complicated and abstract into something practical, easy to understand and practice. Skeptical, critical, logical, determinative and sometimes stubborn. Have a desire to grow and always want to be more advanced from others. Criticism and conflict do not matter much.

Learn to express your emotions and feelings. Try to be more open to the outside world, lots of hanging out, learning a lot, reading lots, visiting lots of places, exploring new things, and broadening insights. Avoid unnecessary debate. Learn to empathize, pay attention and be more sensitive to others.

Researchers, Scientists, Engineers, Technicians, Teachers, Professors, Doctors, Research and Development, Business Analysts, System Analysts, Lawyers, Judges, Programmers, Strategic Positions in organizations.
ENFP or ENTP
"Independent"

Very considerate and sensitive to other people\'s feelings. Full of enthusiasm and loyalty, but usually only for close people. Caring for many things. Tends to take too much and partially complete. Tend to be idealist and perfectionist. Think win-win solution, trust and optimize others.

Learn to face criticism. If good then the criticism can build you, but if not ignore it. Do not hesitate to ask questions and ask for advice. Learn to be assertive. Do not always feel and delight people with good actions. Act well is different from acting right. Do not be too blame yourself and be too hard on yourself. Failure is common and everyone has experienced it. Do not be too good on others but forget yourself. You also have a responsibility to do good to yourself.
Author, Sastrawan, Counselor, Psychologist, Teacher, Artist, Spirituality, Hospitality Sector
ENFJ or ESFJ
"Idealis"

Highly appreciate intellectuality and knowledge. Enjoy theoretical and scientific things. Nice to solve problems with logic and analysis. Silence and restraint. Prefer working alone. Tend to be critical, skeptical, suspicious and pessimistic. Dislikes to lead and can be a less demanding follower. Tend to have a clear interest. Need a career where interest can be developed and useful. If he finds something that interests him, he will be very serious and enthusiastic about it.

Learn to build relationships with others. Learn to empathize, listen actively, give attention and exchange opinions. Relax. Do not think too much. Enjoy your life without having to ask why and how. Try to find one idea, plan it and make it happen. Do not switch ideas too many times, but nothing happens.
Scientist, Photographer, Programmer, Computer Expert, System Analyst, Technical Book Writer, Forensic Expert, Attorney, Lawyer, Technician
ENTJ or ESTJ
"Conceptual"

Spontaneous, Active, Energetic, Sticky, Fast, Spry, Enthusiastic, Fun and full of variety. Communicators, assertive, to the point, ceplas-ceplos, charismatic, have good interpersonal skills. Good in troubleshooting directly on the spot. Able to deal with problems, conflicts and criticism. No worries, enjoy whatever happens. Tends to like something mechanistic, shared activities and sports. Easily adaptable, tolerant, generally conservative about values. Disliked explanation is too long. Best in real things that can be done.

Learn to understand the feelings and thoughts of others especially when talking to them. Learn to be patient, enjoy the process, not all things can be achieved quickly. Occasionally take time to reflect and plan for your future. Try to record your observations including details.
Marketing, Sales, Police, Entrepreneur, Stock Broker, Technical Support
ISFJ or ISTJ
"spontaneous"

Outgoing, easygoing, easy going friends, friendly, very social, friendly, warm and fun. Optimistic, cheerful, enthusiastic, fun, entertaining, likes to be considerate. Have good interpersonal skills, generous, easy sympathetic and recognize the feelings of others. Avoiding conflict and maintaining harmony of a relationship. Know what\'s going on around it and participate in the activity. Excellent in circumstances that require common sense, quick action and practical skills.

Do not be in a hurry to make a decision. Learn to focus and not easily change especially for the important thing. Do not please everyone. And vice versa, not everyone can please you. Learn to face criticism and conflict. Do not run. You have a tendency meterialistis. Be careful not everything can be measured with material or money.
Entertainer, Artist, Marketing, Counselor, Designer, Tour Guide, Children\'s Field, Hospitality Sector
ISTJ or ISFJ
"Generous Heart"

Friendly, warm, energetic, optimistic, enthusiastic, high spirit, fun. Imaginative, full of ideas, creative, innovative. Be able to adapt to various situations and changes. Good at communicating, happy to socialize and bring a positive atmosphere. Easily read the feelings and needs of others.

Learn to focus, be disciplined, firm and consistent. Learn to deal with conflict and criticism. Think of your own needs. Do not forget it because it is too concerned with the needs of others. Do not be too extravagant. Learn to manage finances little by little.
Counselor, Psychologist, Entertainer, Teacher, Motivator, Presenter, Reporter, MC, Artist, Hospitality
INTJ or INFJ
"Optimistic"

Agile, creative, innovative, ingenious, logical, good in many ways. Lots of talk and good debate skills. Can argue for pleasure without feeling guilty. Flexible. Have many ways to solve problems and challenges. Less consistent. Tend to do exciting new things after doing something else. Have a strong desire to develop yourself.

Try to win-win solution. Do not want to win alone. Learn to be disciplined and consistent. Avoid unnecessary debate. Learn to be a bit wary. Balance your point of view from being overly optimistic and taking unrealistic risks. Learn to pay attention to other people\'s feelings.
Lawyer, Psychologist, Consultant, Scientist, Actor, Marketing, Programmer, Photographer
INFJ or INTJ
"Innovative - Creative"

Practical, realistic, sticking to the facts, with a natural drive for business and mechanistic. Very systematic, procedural and planned. Discipline, on time and hardworking. Conservative and tend to be stiff. Not interested in subjects that are not useful to him, but can adjust if necessary. Nice to organize something. Can be a good administrator if they remember to pay attention to the feelings and perspectives of others.

Reduce the desire to control and force others. Learn to control your emotions and anger. Try to introspect yourself and take a moment to contemplate. Learn to be more patient and low profile. Learn to understand others.
Military, Manager, Police, Judge, Lawyer, Teacher, Sales, Auditor, Accountant, System Analyst
ISTP or INTP
"Conservative - Discipline"

Warm, talkative, popular, born to cooperate, supportive and active group members. Requires balance and good in creating harmony. Always do something sweet for others. Work well in situations that support and praise him. Relaxing, easy going, simple, not thinking long. Thorough and diligent care for what he has.

Do not sacrifice yourself just to please others. Do not measure your self-esteem from the treatment, respect and praise of others. Ask others for consideration in making decisions. Learn to be more assertive. Accept life responsibilities and learn to mature. Do not pity yourself. Face criticism and conflict, do not run.
Financial Planner, Nurse, Teacher, Kids Field, Counselor, Administrative, Hospitality
ISFP or INFP
"Harmony"

Creative, imaginative, sensitive, sensitive, loyal. It generally cares about what people say or what others want and tends to do something with other people\'s feelings. Clever, convincing, friendly, fun, popular, sympathetic. Responsive to criticism and praise. Love new variations and challenges. Need appreciation and acceptance.

Do not sacrifice yourself just to please others. Do not measure your self-worth from the treatment of others. Do not get easily disappointed if they are not what you want them to be. Learn to be firm and make decisions. Facing criticism and conflict. Do not be so hard on yourself.
Consultant, Psychologist, Counselor, Educator, Marketing, HRD, Event Coordinator, Entertainer, Author, Motivator
INFP or ISFP
"Assured"

Assertive, assertive, to the point, honestly frank, objective, critical, and have high standards. Dominant, strong will, perfectionist and competitive. Resilient, disciplined, and highly appreciative of commitment. Tends to hide feelings and hide weaknesses. Charisma, good communication, able to move people. Talented leader.

Learn to relax. No need for perfectionism and always competitive with everyone. Express your feelings. Expressing feelings is not a weakness. Learn to manage your emotions. Do not get angry easily. Learn to appreciate and appreciate others. Do not be too arrogant and underestimate others. See the plus side. Do not just look right and wrong.
Entrepreneur, Lawyer, Judge, Consultant, Organization Leader, Business analyst, Financial Field

Share the Result to the World!
You Are
Great!

This simple intelligence test shows that you are a cognitive thinker. So, in general you are able to activate your cognitive system, and able to control your conscious and subconscious. You are able to make decisions and take account of problems through analytical approaches. If you are still curious, please read Dr. Frederick for more details :)

This simple intelligence test shows that you are an Intuitive thinker. So, in general you experience little interference in activating your cognitive system, and instead activate your intuition system. Some of the decisions you make may be because of a mere intuition, not because of analogical calculations. Of course you are brave, because the quick decision, but take into account the decision does not hurt either, is it? If you are still curious, please read Dr. Frederick for more details :)
Cognitive Thinker
Intuitive Thinker
Curious About The Answer?
the answer is actually simple, question number one answer 5, for question number two the answer is also 5, and for question number 3 the answer is 47. already understand what it means? :)
Correct Answer:
Do you have fun? do you learn something new? :)

This application has 2 languages, English and Indonesian. To change it, please change the language preference in your Android phone settings, and automatically the application language will change. Cool, right :)
Multi Language Support

About
Contact Us

MineMind + is the final project for the 'Indonesia Android Kejar' event. This application is designed and created by IAK participants, namely: Aldo Suhartono Putra. This app is a multi quiz, which consists of quiz intelligence, personality quizzes, and fun quiz. 

 This application can be created due to support from many parties. For that, makers want to thank especially to: Google, Indonesia Android Chase, Udacity, StackOverFlow.com (thanks for completing my many errors), Github (thanks for paolorotolo that I use for my app AppIntro). And of course special thanks to Facilitator Muhammad Viga Farizan who has transferred his knowledge. :) 

 For suggestions and feedback, or to contact the author (Aldo Suhartono Putra) please press the button below. Have fun with MineMind + :)

Hello
Welcome to the MineMind + app \n \n We will guide you so you can have fun with this app!
Answer, Answer and Learn

MineMind + has 3 quiz groups, namely Intelligence test, Personality test, and Fun Test. Each test is compiled based on certain standards that have been commonly used. From these three tests, you can learn, increase your knowledge, as well as know more about yourself and how your brain works even further. Wow amazing!
Multi Language

MineMind + is made in such a way as to support the Android localization feature, you only need to change your language preference in your phone settings, and the language in this application will change. Currently MineMind + supports both English and Indonesian. Thanks to Android Localization Features :)
Share and Push

Share your test results worldwide! Each test result can be share to various applications (Thanks to Android Intent). In addition, this app comes with an automatic push for anyone who tweets to @MineMindApp Twitter Account and hashtag #MineMindApp (Thanks to Pushwoosh Service). So you can share more with the world. Not believe this app can push? Please try it for yourself! (Experimental Feature)
From IAK For You

MineMind + is the final project of the \'Indonesia Android Kejar\' event created by Aldo Suhartono Putra, and facilitated by Muhammad Viga Farizan. However, even though this is only the final project, the author try to make the best for you. By the way, if you like this app do not forget to tell your friends. Have fun :)
